column2: FLORIDA DMV PERMIT TEST
column6: FL

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Ramp signals:
column4: control the rate of vehicles entering an expressway.
column6: are considered speed control devices.
column8: control the types of vehicles entering a freeway.
column10: are used to warn drivers of unexpected ramp conditions.

column2: 2. You are driving on a two-lane road with traffic moving in opposite directions, and a solid yellow line is painted on your side of the center line. You:
column6: may pass only if you are within 100 feet of a bridge, tunnel, or railroad crossing.
column8: may cross the solid yellow line when changing lanes.
column10: must pass other vehicles on the right.

column2: 3. The Florida “standard” speed limit on limited access highways is:
column6: 90 MPH.

column2: 4. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 5. Low beam headlamps are only effective for speeds up to ___ MPH.
6. The length of a point suspension is:
column4: 1 year for 24 points within a 36-month period.
column6: 3 months for 18 points within a 18-month period.
column8: 30 days for 12 points within a 12-month period.

column2: 7. This warning sign:
column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
column10: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.

column2: 8. Which of the following is an important benefit of ABS?
column6: The driver can steer the vehicle away from hazards while braking.
column8: It can be turned off by pumping the brakes.

column2: 9. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the right.
column6: not turn right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the left.
column10: increase their speed and keep well to the right.

column2: 10. If you see red reflectors facing you on the lane lines, you:
column4: are on the wrong side of the road.
column6: should turn around or get into the proper lane immediately.

column2: 11. More crashes happen _____________ than any other place.
column6: on highways

column2: 12. For all turning vehicles, the rear wheels follow ____________ the front wheels.
column6: a longer path than

column2: 13. When making a turn, drivers should:
column4: yield the right-of-way to vehicles coming from the opposite direction.
column6: move into the correct lane without using turn signals.
column8: increase their speed to avoid tailgating.

column2: 14. Operators of mopeds must have the minimum of a:
column6: Class C license.

column2: 15. When they meet a truck coming from the opposite direction, drivers should:
column6: keep as far as possible to the side to avoid a sideswipe crash.
column10: speed up while the truck is passing.

column2: 16. When they back up, drivers should NOT:
column6: look directly through the rear window.
column8: depend on rearview or side mirrors to check behind their vehicle.

column2: 17. What does the Implied Consent Law say?
column4: If you drive in Florida, you have agreed by signing your driver license to take a breath or blood alcohol test if asked by an officer.
column6: You are required by law to ask an officer for permission to take a blood or alcohol test.
column8: You can refuse to take a breath or blood test by exercising your Implied Consent rights.
column10: An officer cannot ask for your consent to take a breath or blood test.

column2: 18. Parking is NOT allowed:
column6: within 20 feet of an intersection.
column8: on the right side of the roadway.

column2: 19. An ‘uncontrolled’ or ‘open’ intersection is an intersection where:
column6: no traffic lights or signs are used to indicate the right-of-way.
column8: no law enforcement officer is directing traffic.

column2: 20. Any driver under 21 years of age who is stopped by law enforcement and has a breath alcohol level of .02 or higher will have their driving privilege suspended for:
column6: 6 months.

column2: 21. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column6: green and white.

column2: 22. What is NOT true regarding the use of headlights?
column4: High beam headlights are used when traveling behind other vehicles.
column6: When driving in low visibility, drivers should use low-beam headlights.
column8: High-beams can reveal objects up to a distance of 450 feet.

column2: 23. Alcohol reaches your brain within _____ after consumption.
column6: hours

column2: 24. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column4: even if they are short sighted.
column6: BEFORE you move.

column2: 25. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column10: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 26. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column6: The same as a green light.
column8: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 27. Drivers who throw trash on public streets:
column4: can be charged with a first degree misdemeanor.
column6: can be fined up to a maximum of $150.
column10: are allowed to dump a maximum of 15 pounds of trash.

column2: 28. When parking uphill, you should shift manual gears to:
column6: top.

column2: 29. The sign in the picture:
column6: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column8: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column10: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 30. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: use only one hand on the wheel.
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column10: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

column2: 31. On a two-lane highway, drivers are allowed to drive on the left half of the roadway when:
column4: the lane is reserved for car pool vehicles.
column6: it is safe to pass and passing is allowed.
column10: they are driving slower than the other vehicles.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column4: The maximum speed limit is 35 MPH
column6: The minimum safe speed is 35 MPH
column8: The maximum speed at night is 35 MPH
column10: The recommended speed limit is 35 MPH

column2: 33. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column6: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

column2: 34. The seat belt law applies to passenger cars manufactured beginning with the ____ model year.
column6: most recent

column2: 35. Which shape is a yield sign?
column6: Upside-down triangle

column2: 36. Parking is not allowed within __ feet of an intersection
37. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

column2: 38. A broken white line:
column4: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column6: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column8: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.

column2: 39. When driving slower than the flow of traffic, drivers should __________ so others may safely pass.
column6: keep left

column2: 40. On a three-lane expressway, drivers should use the ____ lane for lower speed driving.
column6: center

column2: 41. At 80 MPH, the braking distance is __ times greater than at 20 MPH.
42. You are looking for a place to park your car and there is a space ahead, near a fire hydrant. You are not allowed to park within ____ of a fire hydrant.
column6: 35 feet.

column2: 43. The sign in the picture:
column4: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column6: means that you need to stop.
column8: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column10: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.

column2: 44. When parking on hills, drivers should:
column6: turn the wheels so that if the car starts to move, it will roll away from traffic or into the curb.
column8: turn wheels to the curb, if they are parking downhill.

column2: 45. High beams are ___________ the fog.
column6: perfect to completely remove
column8: the best choice when driving in
column10: better than low beams when driving in

column2: 46. If a broken yellow line is on your side of the center line:
column4: you may not pass other vehicles.
column6: you may cross the line to pass other vehicles.
column8: you are driving in the left lane.
column10: you have the right-of-way when turning left.

column2: 47. A _________ is the termination of a licensee’s privilege to drive a motor vehicle.
column6: suspension

column2: 48. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column6: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column8: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.

column2: 49. To lower the risk of rear-end collisions, drivers should:
column4: decrease the minimum safe following distance.
column6: signal well in advance for turns and stops.
column10: avoid driving with the flow of traffic.

column2: 50. White lane lines:
column4: are only used in school zones and business areas.
column6: separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
column8: prohibit vehicles moving in either direction from crossing the lines.
column10: separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.
